Welcome to Grafana Cloud Testing & Synthetics app. This interactive guide will walk you through: 

- How to navigate through Testing & Synthetic app main sections
- Understanding the key areas: K6 Performance Testing, Synthetic Monitoring 

## **Tour of Testing & Synthetics**

Let's start by exploring the main areas of Testing & Synthetics. We'll visit each key section so you know where everything is located.

Select Performance
---
This is where you'll find Grafana Cloud k6 performance testing, powered by k6 OSS. In this section you can write and execute performance tests from a variety of geographic locations worldwide to catch failures before they impact your customers.

View the Performance Home Section
----
This is where you'll find your existing load tests, plus helpful guides and documentation to get you started with k6 performance testing

Open the Projects Section
----
This is where all of your K6 projects will live, you can click into existing projects to see test results.

Open the Settings section
----
This is your k6 settings hub where you can manage everything from personal tokens and execution resources to scheduled tests, usage reports, and integrations.

Open the Learn section
----
Finally, this is your k6 learning hub with k6 documentation, CLI guides, JavaScript API documentation, and integration tutorials. Everything you need to master performance testing with k6.

Move To The Synthetic Section
---
The second app in Testing & Synthetics is Grafana Cloud Synthetic Monitoring, which proactively monitors your critical user flows, websites, and APIs from locations worldwide using various checks including browser, HTTP, and ping tests.

View the home dashboard
----
Once you've configured checks, gain insights from dashboards showing metrics for each check segmented by instance, location, errors and other key dimensions.

Select Checks
---
This is where you can quickly view all your checks at a glance. You'll see analytics like uptime, reachability, and latency for each check. You also be able to search for checks by name, endpoint, or label.

Select Probes
---
This is where you'll be able to view private and public probes. Probes are agents that simulate user interactions by sending requests to URLs and measure performance from different geographical locations. You have the options to deploy public or private probes behind firewalls.

Select Alerts
---

This is where you can view and edit alerts for Synthetic Monitoring. Alerts keep you informed when checks fail so you can respond quickly.

Select Config
---
Finally, this is where you'll manage your Synthetic Monitoring configuration settings, including access tokens, Terraform, and secrets.

## **Congratulations!**

You've completed this welcome tour of Testing & Synthetic Section. You now know how to:

- Navigate through the main app sections
- Understand the key areas: k6 Performance Testing and Synthetic Monitoring

You're now ready to start writing your first k6 test and Synthetic Monitoring check!
